Package sceneGraph.math

Class SGVec_3f

  • java.lang.Object
    • sceneGraph.math.SGVec_3f
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Vec<SGVec_3f>, Vec3f<SGVec_3f>, Vecf<SGVec_3f>
    public class SGVec_3f
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Vec3f<SGVec_3f>
    Encapsulates a 3D vector. Allows chaining operations by returning a reference to itself in all modification methods.
    Author:
    badlogicgames@gmail.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      SGVec_3f unrotate​(Matrix4f matrix)
      Multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix.
      SGVec_3f untransform​(Matrix4f matrix)
      Translates this vector in the direction opposite to the translation of the matrix and the multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix.

      • magSq

        public float magSq()
        Description copied from interface: Vecf
        This method is faster than Vecf.mag() because it avoids calculating a square root. It is useful for comparisons, but not for getting exact lengths, as the return value is the square of the actual length.
        Specified by:
        magSq in interface Vecf<SGVec_3f>
        Returns:
        The squared euclidean length

      • distSq

        public float distSq​(SGVec_3f point)
        Description copied from interface: Vecf
        This method is faster than Vecf.dist(Vecf) because it avoids calculating a square root. It is useful for comparisons, but not for getting accurate distances, as the return value is the square of the actual distance.
        Specified by:
        distSq in interface Vecf<SGVec_3f>
        Parameters:
        point - The other vector
        Returns:
        the squared distance between this and the other vector

      • mul4x3

        public SGVec_3f mul4x3​(float[] matrix)
        Left-multiplies the vector by the given 4x3 column major matrix. The matrix should be composed by a 3x3 matrix representing rotation and scale plus a 1x3 matrix representing the translation.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

        This vector for chaining

      • prj

        public SGVec_3f prj​(Matrix4f matrix)
        Multiplies this vector by the given matrix dividing by w, assuming the fourth (w) component of the vector is 1. This is mostly used to project/unproject vectors via a perspective projection matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix.
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

      • rot

        public SGVec_3f rot​(Matrix4f matrix)
        Multiplies this vector by the first three columns of the matrix, essentially only applying rotation and scaling.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining

      • unrotate

        public SGVec_3f unrotate​(Matrix4f matrix)
        Multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix. Note: only works for translation and rotation, does not work for scaling. For those, use rot(Matrix4f) with Matrix4f.inv().
        Parameters:
        matrix - The transformation matrix
        Returns:
        The vector for chaining

      • untransform

        public SGVec_3f untransform​(Matrix4f matrix)
        Translates this vector in the direction opposite to the translation of the matrix and the multiplies this vector by the transpose of the first three columns of the matrix. Note: only works for translation and rotation, does not work for scaling. For those, use mul(Matrix4f) with Matrix4f.inv().
        Parameters:
        matrix - The transformation matrix
        Returns:
        The vector for chaining

      • rotate

        public SGVec_3f rotate​(float degrees,
                       float axisX,
                       float axisY,
                       float axisZ)
        Rotates this vector by the given angle in degrees around the given axis.
        Parameters:
        degrees - the angle in degrees
        axisX - the x-component of the axis
        axisY - the y-component of the axis
        axisZ - the z-component of the axis
        Returns:
        This vector for chaining
